brief_summary.textblock:
The present study is a feasibility study to assess the safety and efficacy of wireless
      capsule endoscope and compare the data obtained with those obtained by using a conventional
      esophagogastroduodenoscopy.

      The product was developed and manufacture in China.(the NaviCam. AKC-1.China)

clinical_study.brief_title: Remote-controlled Capsule Endoscopy: a Feasibility Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  upper abdominal symptoms (≥1 year )

          -  surveillance gastroscopy for  known gastric ulcer or polyps

          -  history of gastric ulcer or polyps （≤1w）at Nanfang Hospital were enrolled.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  dysphagia

          -  suspected or documented  digestive tract malformation ,obstruction, strictures or
             fistula

          -  acute upper GI bleeding,  acute enteritis, acute ischemia disease

          -  history of abdominal operations

          -  impaired renal function, congestive heart failure

          -  patients with critical condition or mental illness

          -  patients with, known allergy to polymer material or  antifoam agent

          -  patients with cardiac pacemakers or other implanted electromedical devices，magnetic
             resonance imaging ( mri) examination in 7 days

          -  pregnancy

link.description: Inspection of the human stomach using remote-controlled capsule endoscopy: a feasibility study in healthy volunteers

facility.name: Departement of Gastroenterology, Nanfang Hospital, Southern Medical University

clinical_study.official_title: Remote-controlled Capsule Endoscopy: a Feasibility Study

oversight_info.authority: China:Institutional Review Board of Nanfang Hospital, Southern Medical University

primary_outcome.description: the percentage of patients in whom there was complete visualization of the gastric surface in the antrum, body, and fundus and identification of the cardia and pylorus
primary_outcome.measure: the percentage of complete visualization of anatomic landmarks

primary_outcome.description: examination time and the percentage of abnormal findings seen on gastroscopy that were reproducible by capsule endoscopy
primary_outcome.measure: examination time and the percentage of abnormal finding

reference.citation: Keller J, Fibbe C, Volke F, Gerber J, Mosse AC, Reimann-Zawadzki M, Rabinovitz E, Layer P, Schmitt D, Andresen V, Rosien U, Swain P. Inspection of the human stomach using remote-controlled capsule endoscopy: a feasibility study in healthy volunteers (with videos). Gastrointest Endosc. 2011 Jan;73(1):22-8. doi: 10.1016/j.gie.2010.08.053. Epub 2010 Nov 9.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

secondary_outcome.description: any discomfort like chest pain, nausea will be documented. capsule retention（defined as not extrusion in 14 days）will be documented.

Acceptability to patients was assessed by means of a questionnaire, with ratings on a scale of 0 to 10 and examination chosen for next time. completed in the recovery room immediately after capsule examination.

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
